definition[0]: if a machine, tool etc shuts off or if you shut it off, it stops operating
example[0]: The iron shuts off automatically if it gets too hot.
example[1]: I let the engine run for a minute and then shut it off.
example[2]: Don’t forget to shut off the water supply.
definition[1]: to prevent goods or supplies from being available or being delivered
example[3]: a strike that closed the mines and shut off coal supplies
definition[2]: to avoid meeting and talking to other people
example[4]: He was cold and remote, shutting himself off from her completely.
definition[3]: to be separated from other people or things, especially so that you are not influenced by them
example[5]: The valley is shut off from the modern world.
